visualization_prompt: Create a Highcharts chartOptions object to render a column chart with the following specifications: Chart type: column, Chart title: 'Monthly Sales Data', Axes and labels styling: Use a dark blue color (#003366) for the title, axis labels, and legend text, with a font size of 14px. Data series: Series 1 - 'Product A' with data [10, 15, 13, 17], Series 2 - 'Product B' with data [7, 12, 10, 14], Series 3 - 'Product C' with data [5, 9, 7, 11]. Custom colors: Use colors ['#FF6384', '#36A2EB', '#FFCE56'] for the series. Additional configurations: Set chart margins to 50px, add a light gray background (#F5F5F5) to the chart, and display the legend at the bottom of the chart.
visualization_explanation: The provided Highcharts chartOptions object is configured to render a column chart with specific styling and data series. The chart type is set to 'column', and the title is 'Monthly Sales Data' with a dark blue color and a font size of 14px. The x-axis categories are months from January to April, and the y-axis title is 'Sales' with the same styling. The legend is positioned at the bottom of the chart, and its text is also styled with the dark blue color and a font size of 14px. The data series include 'Product A', 'Product B', and 'Product C', each with their respective sales data and custom colors. The chart has a margin of 50px and a light gray background color for better visibility.
